name: I was guilty
description:
This is my Ludum Dare 44 entry

A short contemplative game about self-exploration and redemption.

You have to find three clues about what happened on this temple island. Press space to read a clue when you think you are near one. The connection with the theme is not apparent at first: you have to unravel the story to see it.

There is no audio.

Available versions :

  • Windows version: A desktop height resolution greater than 1024 is advised (e.g. 1920x1080), but if not, this should rescale automatically to fit (except in fullscreen mode).
  • (Update 2019-04-29) a web version is now available! Note: it is slightly more pixelated when rotating, for performances reasons. Loading can take a moment, be patient. If your Internet browser window is smaller than the needed resolution (1024x1024 pixels), the key Ctrl+Minus on most browsers scales down the image.

Made with Golang+Ebiten for the programming part, and MagicaVoxel+Krita for the graphics part.

Play directly on the web
